cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW, cross the Yucatan Channel late Monday, enter the southern Gulf Tuesday, then accelerate northward toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) by mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for Pinar del Río, Cuba (no U.S. coast yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula Monday–Tuesday, then northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Mississippi by Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.wind: 20–30% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) late Wednesday into early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 2–4 ft of surge possible along the Mississippi coast including Pascagoula if the system strengthens to a hurricane before landfall
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain Wednesday–Thursday causing localized flooding at and near the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands and short-fuse squalls could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements
